channel.title: Bank and logout text
channel.description: how do I change the "The bank of runescape" and "Click here to logout of runescape safely..." text. there not in my source or client.

item.title: Bank and logout text
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

This is a pretty easy way for beginners if they want it to say their servers name instead of RuneScape.

Or, instead of hardcoding the values client-side, using the existing functionality, and setting the dynamic values server-side (which is what we were doing for years). Why this sudden shift to client-side is very strange.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank and logout text
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

This is a pretty easy way for beginners if they want it to say their servers name instead of RuneScape.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank and logout text
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:2, topic:478991”]Go into RSInterface and search for this: if(rsInterface.type == 4) {
Below it, there will be a line similar to this one: rsInterface.message = stream.readString();
Delete it or comment it out, your choice. Then add this right below it and change the SERVER_NAME to yours: rsInterface.message = stream.readString().replaceAll("RuneScape", "SERVER_NAME");[/quote]

Why do people insist on hardcoding the branding into every single client they release?

Read full topic

item.title: Bank and logout text
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Go into RSInterface and search for this: if(rsInterface.type == 4) {
Below it, there will be a line similar to this one: rsInterface.message = stream.readString();
Delete it or comment it out, your choice. Then add this right below it and change the SERVER_NAME to yours: rsInterface.message = stream.readString().replaceAll("RuneScape", "SERVER_NAME");

Read full topic
